citations.narrative:
A female Shih Tzu, "Jada" (no id) was in the whelping box nursing puppies. She was thin and her ribs, lumbar vertebrae
and pelvic bones were easily visible, with no palpable fat. The licensee states that she is on a higher quality dry puppy
food, but based on her condition and the nutritional needs she requires to nurse puppies, additional supplementation of
nutritive value should be provided to maintain the normal condition and weight of the animal during this life stage.
Another female Shih Tzu, "Glorianna" #260 who is pregnant and due to whelp soon was also thin and her ribs, lumbar
vertebrae and pelvic bones were easily visible, with no palpable fat. This dog is also on higher quality dry puppy food, but
based on her condition and the nutritional needs she requires to nurse puppies, additional supplementation of nutritive
value should be provided to maintain the normal condition and weight of the animal during this life stage.
Correct by: March 10, 2022

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
There is a large accumulation of feces that has not been removed from the outdoor run for the three large breed dogs.
Fecal and food waste must be removed from primary enclosures daily to prevent the dogs from becoming soiled and to
reduce disease hazards, pests and odors.
Correct by: March 9, 2022
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End Section

narrative:

Feeding

and pelvic bones were easily visible, with no palpable fat. The licensee states that she is on a higher quality dry puppy 
food, but based on her condition and the nutritional needs she requires to nurse puppies, additional supplementation of

Another female Shih Tzu, "Glorianna" #260 who is pregnant and due to whelp soon was also thin and her ribs, lumbar

3.11(a)  Repeat
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.

There is a large accumulation of feces that has not been removed from the outdoor run for the three large breed dogs. 
Fecal and food waste must be removed from primary enclosures daily to prevent the dogs from becoming soiled and to 
reduce disease hazards, pests and odors. 
 
Correct by: March 9, 2022 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End Section
